Optimize Single Cell RNA-seq Analysis

Source: R/seurat_utils.R
optimize_single_cell.Rd

This function performs a comprehensive single-cell RNA-seq analysis pipeline including quality control, normalization, dimensionality reduction, clustering optimization, and visualization. It automatically saves parameters, session info, and generates multiple QC and analysis plots.

optimize_single_cell(
  object = NULL,
  normalization.method = "LogNormalize",
  vf.method = "vst",
  model.use = "linear",
  pseudobulk_var = "patient_tp_mutation",
  pseudo_cutoff = 30,
  colors = NULL,
  mt.cutoff = 25,
  nfeatures = 2000,
  harmony = FALSE,
  harmony_vars = NULL,
  reduction = "pca",
  improved_diff_quantile = 0.6,
  k_range = c(10, 20, 30),
  resolution_range = seq(0.1, 0.3, 0.1),
  min.dist = 0.4,
  seed = 17,
  gene_filter = 50,
  regress.out = NULL,
  clusters_min = 4,
  clusters_max = 13,
  min.pct = 0.3,
  lower_bound_param = 1,
  higher_bound_param = 2,
  cluster_distribution_layers = NULL,
  cluster_distribution_layer_orders = NULL,
  out_dir = getwd(),
  features = NULL
)

Arguments

object

A Seurat object.

normalization.method

Method for normalization. Default is "LogNormalize". Please refer to Seurat::NormalizeData() for more options.

vf.method

Method for variable feature selection. Options include "vst", "dispersion", "pseudobulk", "sct", or "anchor". Default is "vst".

model.use

Model to use for scaling. Default is "linear". Please refer to Seurat::ScaleData() for more options.

pseudobulk_var

Variable name for pseudobulk aggregation. Default is "patient_tp_mutation".

pseudo_cutoff

Minimum number of cells required for pseudobulk calculation. Default is 30.

colors

Named vector of colors for plotting. Default is NULL.

mt.cutoff

Maximum percent mitochondrial content threshold for cell filtering. Default is 25.

nfeatures

Number of variable features to select. Default is 2000.

harmony

Logical indicating whether to run Harmony batch correction. Default is FALSE.

harmony_vars

Character vector of variable names to use for Harmony correction. e.g. run, experiment, patient. Default is NULL.

reduction

Dimensionality reduction method to use ("pca" or "harmony"). Default is "pca".

improved_diff_quantile

Quantile threshold for PC selection. Lower values select more PCs. Default is 0.6.

k_range

Vector of k values for nearest neighbor calculations. Default is c(10, 20, 30).

resolution_range

Vector of resolution values for clustering. Default is seq(0.1, 0.3, 0.1).

min.dist

Minimum distance parameter for UMAP. Default is 0.4.

seed

Random seed for reproducibility. Default is 17.

gene_filter

Minimum number of cells a gene must be expressed in to be retained. Default is 50.

regress.out

Variables to regress out during scaling, e.g. proliterating genes. Default is NULL.

clusters_min

Minimum number of clusters expected. Default is 4.

clusters_max

Maximum number of clusters expected. Default is 13.

min.pct

Minimum percentage expressed required for a gene to become DEG. Default is 0.3.

lower_bound_param

Lower bound parameter for low-quality cluster removal. To be more stringent, decrease this parameter. Default is 1.

higher_bound_param

Upper bound parameter for low-quality cluster removal. To be more stringent, increase this parameter. Default is 2.

cluster_distribution_layers

Character vector of metadata columns for cluster distribution plots. Default is NULL.

cluster_distribution_layer_orders

List of factor level orders for distribution layers. Default is NULL.

out_dir

Output directory for saving results. Default is current working directory.

features

Data frame or list of selected features for visualization. Default is NULL.

Value

A processed Seurat object with clustering and dimensionality reduction completed. The object is also saved as "object.rds" in the output directory.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Creates output directory and logs parameters and session info

  2. Filters genes by expression threshold

  3. Processes variable features using specified method

  4. Runs PCA and optionally Harmony batch correction

  5. Performs initial clustering at high resolution for QC

  6. Removes low-quality clusters and high mitochondrial content cells

  7. Re-processes variable features after QC

  8. Selects optimal number of PCs

  9. Runs clustering across multiple k and resolution parameters

  10. Generates comprehensive visualizations including cluster distributions, dotplots, and heatmaps

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage
seurat_obj <- optimize_single_cell(
  object = my_seurat_object,
  out_dir = "results/analysis_v1"
)

# With Harmony batch correction
seurat_obj <- optimize_single_cell(
  object = my_seurat_object,
  harmony = TRUE,
  harmony_vars = c("batch", "donor"),
  out_dir = "results/harmony_analysis"
)

# Custom clustering parameters
seurat_obj <- optimize_single_cell(
  object = my_seurat_object,
  k_range = c(15, 25, 35),
  resolution_range = seq(0.2, 0.8, 0.2),
  clusters_min = 5,
  clusters_max = 15,
  out_dir = "results/custom_clustering"
)
} # }
